terms.term: OpenID Connect, a simple identity layer on top of the OAuth 2.0 protocol; used for SSO, authentication, and authorisation.
Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable; a set of principles to make data more reusable.
Orphanet Rare Disease Ontology, an ontology for rare diseases.
Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms, a clinical terminology system.
Human Phenotype Ontology, a standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities.
Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man, a comprehensive compendium of human genes and genetic phenotypes.
National Cancer Institute Thesaurus, a reference terminology for cancer research.
HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee, a committee that assigns standardised nomenclature to human genes.
Beacon v2 is a protocol and specification established by the GA4GH that defines an open standard for the discovery of genomic (and phenoclinic) data in biomedical research and clinical applications.
Global Alliance for Genomics and Health, an international coalition that aims to enable the sharing of genomic and clinical data.
Sonatype Nexus, a repository manager that allows you to proxy, collect, and manage dependencies, files and other artifacts.
An open-source identity and access management solution.
HashiCorp Vault, a tool for managing secrets and protecting sensitive data.
PEM format, a base64-encoded format for storing and transferring cryptographic keys.
JSON Web Key, a JSON object that represents a cryptographic key.
JSON Web Key Set, a JSON object that represents a set of JSON Web Keys.
A realm is a domain of users that share the same identity, authentication, and authorisation policies.
Key-Value Engine, a storage engine that stores key-value pairs.
A platform for scientific data management. It specialises in versatile data management and database solutions.
UUID4 is a 128-bit identifier, randomly generated and represented as a 32-character hexadecimal string in the format xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx.
